channel.title: Microsoft on tiagosalgado.com
channel.description: Recent content in Microsoft on tiagosalgado.com

item.title: Build 2013 – Sessions available
item.description:
Build 2013 is over, and now is time to see some sessions we couldn’t watch live.

All sessions are now available on Channel9 to download and watch when you want.

Channel9 – Build 2013 Sessions List

item.title: Visual Studio 2012 Update 2
item.description:
It’s available a new update for Visual Studio 2012. You can read the announcement on¬†Somasegar blog post.

You can download it from here, and if you need to make an offline install or just distribute, you can do it running the following command: “VS2012.2.exe /layout” and select the folder where do you want to download all files.

item.title: ASP.NET and Web Tools 2012.2 Update
item.description:
The final release is here üôÇ

You can find a lot of new features and¬†enhancements¬† on ASP.NET Web API, ASP.NET SignalR, ASP.NET Webforms and MVC and of course Windows Azure.

You can found some blog posts covering this new updates:

  • Announcing release of ASP.NET and Web Tools 2012.2 Update – by Scott Gu
  • Released: ASP.NET and Web Tools 2012.2 in Context – by Scott Hanselman
  • Announcing the ASP.NET and Web Tools 2012.2 Release! – By Jon Galloway

item.title: Outlook – there are no items to show in this view error
item.description:
This message was¬†annoying¬†me several times in last days. After a quick search on Google I’ve found a support article from Microsoft saying that is a know issue.

There is an¬†hotfix¬†for this, or you each time you’ll get this message you can go to View > Expand / Collapse Groups > Expand All Groups.

item.title: Microsoft new logo
item.description: After 25 years, Microsoft has a new look.

item.title: Productivity Future Vision by Microsoft
item.description: Watch how future technology will help people make better use of their time, focus their attention, and strengthen relationships while getting things done at work, home, and on the go.

item.title: Concurso Reach the Cloud
item.description:
Grande pr√©mio

Um voo de 25 min. num ca√ßa de combate L-39 Albatros. A experi√™ncia inclui manobras de voo como loopings, subidas e descidas a pique. ATEN√á√ÉO: o pr√©mio s√≥ √© concedido a pessoas sem problemas de sa√∫de sendo exigida a apresenta√ß√£o de electrocardiograma. Caso o vencedor n√£o preencha os requisitos m√©dicos, ser-lhe-√° atribu√≠do um pr√©mio alternativo (por exemplo, viagem em bal√£o). O pr√©mio inclui uma viagem de fim-de-semana para uma pessoa a Usedom, Alemanha, com estadia em hotel, aluguer de autom√≥vel e voo (valor total aprox. de 10,000 USD).

Pr√©mios regionais

1¬∫: uma XBOX 360 com televisor de topo e uma Kinect
2¬∫: um port√°til com Windows 7
3¬∫: um telem√≥vel Windows Phone 7 (sem contrato de comunica√ß√µes)

Pr√©mio especial

Os primeiros 250 participantes que se registem no desafio receber√£o um helic√≥ptero R/C.

Todas as informa√ß√µes em Reach the Cloud.

item.title: How-to Index for Windows Azure
item.description:
How to: Build a Windows Azure Application

  • How to Configure Virtual Machine Sizes
  • How to Configure Connection Strings
  • How to Configure Operating System Versions
  • How to Configure Local Storage Resources
  • How to Create a Certificate for a Role
  • How to Create a Remote Desktop Protocol File
  • How to Define Environment Variables Before a Role Starts
  • How to Define Input Endpoints for a Role
  • How to Define Internal Endpoints for a Role
  • How to Define Startup Tasks for a Role
  • How to Encrypt a Password
  • How to Restrict Communication Between Roles
  • How to Retrieve Role Instance Data
  • How to Use the RoleEnvironment.Changing Event
  • How to Use the RoleEnvironment.Changed Event

How to: Use the Windows Azure SDK Tools to Package and Deploy an Application

  • How to Prepare the Windows Azure Compute Emulator
  • How to Configure the Compute Emulator to Emulate Windows Azure
  • How to Package an Application by Using the CSPack Command-Line Tool
  • How to Run an Application in the Compute Emulator by Using the CSRun Command-Line Tool
  • How to Initialize the Storage Emulator by Using the DSInit Command-Line Tool
  • How to Change the Configuration of a Running Service
  • How to Attach a Debugger to New Role Instances
  • How to View Trace Information in the Compute Emulator
  • How to Configure SQL Server for the Storage Emulator

How to: Configure a Web Application

  • How to Configure a Web Role for Multiple Web Sites
  • How to Configure the Virtual Directory Location
  • How to Configure a Windows Azure Port
  • How to Configure the Site Entry in the Service Definition File
  • How to Configure IIS Components in Windows Azure
  • How to Configure a Service to Use a Legacy Web Role****

How to: Manage Windows Azure VM Roles

  • How to Create the Base VHD for a VM Role in Windows Azure
  • How to Install the Windows Azure Integration Components
  • How to Enable Windows Azure Connect for a VM Role
  • How to Develop an Adapter for a VM Role in Windows Azure
  • How to Prepare the Server Image for Uploading to Windows Azure
  • How to Upload a VHD to Windows Azure
  • How to Create and Deploy the VM Role Service Model
  • How to Use Certificates With a VM Role in Windows Azure
  • How to Change a Server Image for a VM Role by Using a Differencing VHD
  • How to Change the Configuration of a VM role
  • How to Manage the Lifecycle of VM Role Instances in Windows Azure****

How to: Administering Windows Azure Hosted Services

  • How to Setup a Windows Azure Subscription
  • How to Setup Multiple Administrator Accounts****

How to: Deploy a Windows Azure Application

  • How to Package your Service
  • How to Deploy a Service
  • How to Create a Hosted Service
  • How to Create a Storage Account
  • How to Configure the Service Topology****

How to: Upgrade a Service

  • How to Perform In-Place Upgrades
  • How to Swap a Service’s VIPs****

How to: Manage Upgrades to the Windows Azure Guest OS

  • How to Determine the Current Guest OS of your Service
  • How to Upgrade the Guest OS in the Management Portal
  • How to Upgrade the Guest OS in the Service Configuration File****

How to: Manage Management Certificates

  • How to Create a Management Certificate
  • How to Add a Management Certificate to a Windows Azure Subscription****

How to: Manage Service Certificates

  • How to Add a New Certificate to the Certificate Store
  • How to Associate a Certificate with a Service
  • How to Update a Certificate in the Certificate Store
  • How to Configure an HTTPS Endpoint in Windows Azure
  • How to Control Access to Certificates on a Virtual Machine****

How to: Use Storage Services

  • How to Create a Storage Account
  • How to Read Configuration Settings for the Storage Client Library and Handle Changed Settings****

How to: Configure Windows Azure Connect

  • How to Activate Windows Azure Roles for Windows Azure Connect
  • How to Install Local Endpoints with Windows Azure Connect
  • How to Create and Configure a Group of Endpoints in Windows Azure Connect****

How to: Manage CDN on Windows Azure

  • How to Enable CDN for Windows Azure
  • How to Map CDN Content to a Custom Domain
  • How to Remove Content from the CDN
  • How to Manage Expiration of Blob Content
  • How to Manage Expiration of Hosted Service Content

 

from: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg432998.aspx (via http://blogs.msdn.com/b/otavio/)

item.title: Microsoft Virtual Academy
item.description:
Microsoft Virtual Academy ‚Äì MVA is a fully cloud-based learning experience focusing on Microsoft Cloud Technologies. You can access a variety of training content online and become one of the renowned experts in the IT Pro community around the world. MVA provides its users with a virtual university experience: the student can select a course and study the material and then do the self-assessment. By doing so, he will collect points that will promote him to a Bronze, Silver, Gold or Platinum Level. Students on MVA can get access to all the information, statistics and advancements of their training career, allowing them to maintain a long-term relationship with Microsoft. Learning through MVA is free of charge, and you can study the contents at any time and at your own pace.
The MVA platform is hosted on the latest Microsoft Azure technology, which guarantees that your learning experience will flow uninterruptedly for the best online learning experience ever!

https://www.microsoftvirtualacademy.com

item.title: Asynchronous Programming for C# and Visual Basic
item.description:
Visual Studio Async CTP

Download a CTP with new syntax and APIs for asynchronous development.

Whitepaper: Asynchrony in .NET

Get an overview of the new asynchronous features being developed for C#, Visual Basic and the .NET Framework.

Walkthrough: Getting Started with Async

Follow step-by-step instructions for converting a synchronous solution in Visual Basic or C# to an asynchronous one by using the new asynchronous features.

Iterators in Visual Basic

Learn about the iterators that this CTP introduces in Visual Basic.¬†An iterator function or get accessor performs a custom iteration over a collection, and uses the Yield statement to return each element in turn.

101 Samples in C# and Visual Basic

Download the CTP and then use the 101 samples (in DocumentsMicrosoft Visual Studio Async CTPSamples) to try the new Async CTP features yourself. Check back for an online version coming soon.

item.title: Windows Live Writer plugins
item.description:
J√° uso h√° bastante tempo o Windows Live Writer como ferramenta de publica√ß√£o nos meus blogs, e vou sempre procurando plugins que me possam facilitar a tarefa de cria√ß√£o de posts.

Fa√ßo este post n√£o s√≥ para divulga√ß√£o de alguns plugins, mas tamb√©m para ficar como minha refer√™ncia no caso de me esquecer de algum quando precisar de reinstalar o PC.

Seguem ent√£o alguns plugins sem qualquer ordem de import√¢ncia:

  1. Facebook Live Writer Plugin
  2. On the fly Zip and attach Live Writer Plugin
  3. Tag Generator
  4. Imtech MSDN Reference Plugin
  5. SnagIt Screen Capture Plugin
  6. SkyDrive Attachment plugin
  7. Insert Code for Windows Live Writer
  8. ImageShack

 

Podem encontrar mais plugins na Windows Live Gallery, e caso tenham algum para recomendar √© s√≥ indicar nos coment√°rios.

item.title: Alterar as defini√µes da Data Execution Prevention
item.description:
Ao tentar instalar o My Mobiler no Windows Server 2008, fui impedido de continuar e fazer a liga√ß√£o com o PDA devido √†s defini√ß√µes da DEP.

Para contornar isto, √© necess√°rio indicar quais os programas que ser√£o considerados como excep√ß√£o e assim conseguir avan√ßar na instala√ß√£o.

  1. Control Panel > System > Advanced System Settings
  2. Performance Settings
  3. Data Execution Prevention e escolher a op√ß√£o ‚ÄúTurn on DEP for all programs and services except those I select‚Äù
  4. Por fim seleccionar os programas que queremos definir como excep√ß√£o

item.title: SQL Server 2008 Deep Dive
item.description:
Vai-se realizar dia 10 e 15 de Setembro, em Lisboa e no Porto respectivamente, um evento que aborda principalmente as novas funcionalidades presentes no SQL Server 2008.

Resource Governor, Partitioning, Auditing, X-Events s√£o alguns dos temas que ir√£o ser abordados neste evento, mas o programa completo pode ser visto aqui.

Podem fazer a inscri√ß√£o nos seguintes links:

Lisboa – 10 de Setembro no Audit√≥rio Microsoft (TagusPark)

Porto – 15 de Setembro na Funda√ß√£o Dr. Ant√≥nio Cupertino de Miranda

Programa do Evento

item.title: Data Source Configuration Wizard n√£o lista os datasources disponiveis
item.description:
H√° uns tempos atr√°s tive um problema com o meu Visual Studio que, devido ao tempo disponivel para solucionar o problema ter-se esgotado, levou-me a formatar a m√°quina para voltar tudo √† normalidade.

Ao utilizar o Wizard para criar um Data Source, a listagem dos tipos que teria disponiveis n√£o me estava a aparecer

Pelos vistos apareceu mais alguem com o mesmo problema e conseguiu resolver sem a trabalheira de formatar e instalar tudo novamente como podem ver aqui.
